Authors:
Konstanze Schubert, Alina Greslebin, Johannes (Ewald)
Zacharias Groenewald, Pedro W. Crous
Title:
New foliicolous species of Cladosporium from South
America
Abstract:
Two new species of Cladosporium found on necrotic needles
of Pinus ponderosa trees in Patagonia, Argentina, are described as C.
chubutense and C. pini-ponderosae. An additional isolate from dead
leaves of Cortaderia collected in Colombia, which is a sister taxon to
the species occurring on Pinus is described as Cladosporium colombiae.
These species are phylogenetically closely related, but differ from each
other and other known species by multilocus sequence data, phenetic
characters and culture characteristics.

trees.title: Cladosporium, 1 of 4 MPTs from ITS data.
Cladosporium, 1 of 1000 MPTs from ACT data.
Cladosporium, 1 of 12 MPTs from TEF data.
